events.1818: Dominion of Holkar in India are annexed with Rajput states and come under the British protection.
events.1932: Meenatai Thackrey, social worker, was born.
events.1942: Four of the flight's six aircraft were promptly lost to Japanese bombing and No. 4 Flight gave place in Moulmein to No. 3 Flight which had meanwhile re-equipped with four ex-RAF Blenheim ls. B-314 completed first commercial flight around the world.
events.1947: All India Congress Commitee accepted the division of country.
events.1948: Security Council takes up India's complaint charging Pakistan with aggression in Kashmir.
events.1953: Stalin Peace Prize awarded to Dr. S. Kitchlew.
events.1959: Kapildev Ramlal Nikhanj, cricketer (India's finest all-rounder 1978-94, Cup-1982), was born in Chandigarh.
events.1972: America declared Naval Drill in the Indian Ocean.
events.1976: Baliram Bhagat elected Lok Sabha Speaker.
events.1979: Rohini-200, first monsoon experimental rocket, launched from Thumba.
events.1980: In the general election (7th) of India, Indira Gandhi led Indian National Congress Party gains two-thirds majority in the Lok Sabha legislative elections.
events.1981: Indian Ocean bed on their research ship Gavesani of the National Institute succeeded from the depth of 4,300 metres.
events.1983: Indian National Congress lost for the first time in Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka State Assembly Elections.
events.1987: Jaidev, famous music director, passed away.
events.1992: Sachin Tendulkar completes 148* vs Australia at the SCG.
events.1993: India and Bhutan sign agreement on the giant Sankosh hydro-electric project.
events.1996: CBI identifies two key figures - Satyanarayana Gauda and Daya Manikam Anand - in Purulia arms drop case.
events.1997: Sumita Ghosh (CISF) sets a National junior women's record in the standard rifle 3 position in National shooting.
events.1999: Shiv Sena activists dug up the Kotla pitch in Delhi with a view to prevent the Indo-Pakistan first Test which was to commence from Jan. 28.
